body_html:
Yes, as of this moment the install instruction webpages (https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_linux and https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_windows) still show CUDA 8.0 and cuDNN 6.0, as noted in #16477
@gunan @tylerlekang

Yes I followed the instruction and didn't update the CUDA when the exception happened.

I upgraded CUDA and cudnn in my laptop (GTX 1050ti) and it worked.
After updating to CUDA 9.0, cudnn 7 and Tensorflow 1.5, some model that I am now working with trains 25% faster than before in my laptop.

Interestingly, The old tensorflow 1.4 still works under CUDA 9.0.

It seems to be safe to upgrade tensorflow 1.5 for my legacy code. So I will do the same thing for the desktop.

Thanks a lot!

body:
>Yes, as of this moment the install instruction webpages (https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_linux and https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_windows) still show CUDA 8.0 and cuDNN 6.0, as noted in #16477
@gunan @tylerlekang 

Yes I followed the instruction and didn't update the CUDA when the exception happened.
 
I upgraded CUDA and cudnn in my laptop (GTX 1050ti) and it worked. 
After updating to CUDA 9.0, cudnn 7 and Tensorflow 1.5, some model that I am now working with trains 25% faster than before in my laptop.

Interestingly, The old tensorflow 1.4 still works under CUDA 9.0.

It seems to be safe to upgrade tensorflow 1.5 for my legacy code. So I will do the same thing for the desktop.

Thanks a lot!
